required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Intrauterine Lidocaine for Pain Control During Laminaria Insertion Prior to Dilation & Evacuation (D&E)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study to investigate whether instilling a small amount of liquid lidocaine into the uterus will decrease pain felt by women during laminaria insertions done for cervical dilation prior to second trimester abortion.
The investigators hypothesize that women who receive intrauterine lidocaine in addition to a paracervical block will experience less pain than women who receive only a paracervical block.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Patient self-report of pain score during laminaria insertion, scored on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient self-report of maximum recalled pain during interval between laminaria insertion and abortion procedure, scored on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale

arm_group.description: The experimental arm will receive 100mg lidocaine (5mL of 2% concentration) instilled into the uterine cavity via a flexible trans-cervical catheter immediately prior to laminaria insertion.
Placebo arm will receive 5mL of normal saline instilled into the uterine cavity via a flexible trans-cervical catheter immediately prior to laminaria insertion.

intervention.description: 100mg of liquid lidocaine, single dose, instilled into the uterine cavity via a flexible trans-cervical catheter immediately prior to laminaria insertion.
5mL of normal saline, instilled into the uterus via a flexible trans-cervical catheter immediately prior to laminaria insertion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Can sign informed consent
- Healthy pregnant females
- Weight over 45kg
- Seeking abortion by dilation and evacuation in the second trimester of pregnancy
- Gestational age 14-24 weeks confirmed by clinic ultrasound
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy or previous reaction to lidocaine, bupivicaine or other anesthetic agent
- Known allergy or previous reaction to ibuprofen or other NSAID

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
